title: 114_s1016
content: The "Preserving Freedom and Choice in Health Care Act" repeals the individual and employer mandates of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, along with modifications to premium assistance credit. The "Preserving Freedom and Choice in Health Care Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a special rule for individuals enrolled through a federal exchange who are not eligible for the credit allowed under subsection (a) due to a Supreme Court ruling. The "Preserving Freedom and Choice in Health Care Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code to limit the premium assistance credit amount to zero for individuals not previously enrolled in a qualified health plan through an Exchange established under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act before a certain date. The amendments made by this section apply to months beginning after December 31, 2013. SEC. 5. FREEDOM TO MAINTAIN EXISTING COVERAGE. Amends the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to ensure individuals can maintain their existing coverage. The Act ensures that individuals can keep their current group health plan or insurance coverage from the date of enactment until December 31, 2017, without being required to make any changes. The Act allows family members of individuals enrolled in a group health plan or insurance coverage from the date of enactment until December 31, 2017, to join the plan if permitted. Additionally, new employees and their families can also enroll in the plan during this period. The provisions of this subtitle and subtitle A shall not apply to health insurance coverage under collective bargaining agreements ratified before December 31, 2017, until the agreements terminate. Any coverage amendments solely to comply with this subtitle or subtitle A are not considered termination of the agreements. The term 'grandfathered health plan' refers to group health plans or insurance coverage under collective bargaining agreements before December 31, 2017. The amendment takes effect as part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. SEC. 6. ESSENTIAL HEALTH BENEFITS. Amends sections of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to define essential health benefits package and include benefits required by the State in which a health plan is offered. Effective date is retroactive to the Act's enactment.
